alert.note: Alert for Hooker; Logan; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 12 at 6:10AM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ THIS EVENING TO NOON CST /11 AM MST/ TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Hooker, Thomas, Logan and Western Cherry Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ this evening. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ this evening to noon CST /11 AM MST/ Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Blustery winds may result in residual blowing and drifting snow, even after the falling snow stops. Be prepared for slick spots and reduced visibility at times.
